alert.note: Alert for Kidder; Logan; McIntosh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 12 at 3:07AM CDT until October 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA... .Critical fire weather conditions are expected across western and central North Dakota this afternoon through early this evening. Northwest winds sustained to 35 mph with peak gusts as high as 55 mph are expected, with minimum relative humidity dropping as low as 25 percent. Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly and be difficult to control or suppress. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA... The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * AFFECTED AREA...Western and Central North Dakota. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly and become difficult to control or suppress.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
